ngiemboon: Yɔ̀ɔn nò la cʉate fʉ̀ʼ gie Zɛɛzɛ́sè la ne sáʼa láʼ. Fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè ŋwɛ́ lɔ̌ɔn sáʼa meláʼ nkÿo né ntsɔ̀b sɔɔnmbʉ́a né móm mbʉ́a, léfóo Iŋnde ńgʉa tà ńkúu Kushʉ̀.
en: These events took place during the days of Ahasuerus,   who ruled 127 provinces  # 1:1 Est 8:9; 9:30 from India to Cush.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼ ayɛ̌, fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ yé á Sẅísè gẅie à laa sẅɛ̂láʼ.
en: In those days King Ahasuerus reigned from his royal throne   in the fortress at Susa.  # 1:2 Ezr 4:9; Neh 1:1; Dn 8:2

ngiemboon: À la gwɔ́ néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ ngùʼ tá, ńgÿo máamáa línɔ̀ɔn, ńtí pangúmnɔ̀ɔn pé pâ meŋwǎláʼ pé. À la gíŋe ńtóŋ patyémvfò na palÿɔ́ʼncù Pɛ́ɛsè mbɔɔ Mendɛ́sè pâ mekěm, ńgÿo patyé twómvfò na meláʼ.
en: He held a feast   in the third year of his reign for all his officials and staff, the army of Persia and Media,  # 1:3 Dn 5:28 the nobles,  # 1:3 Est 6:9; Dn 1:3 and the officials from the provinces.

ngiemboon: À la nyɛ shúm tʉ̀nzẅìŋ sie ée tsɛ̀ɛ lefùɔ sé mbɔɔ páʼ lefùɔ ŋwɛ́ la poŋ ḿbiŋ fáŋ púʼu. Mé la jÿó línɔ̀ɔn ayɛ̌ jÿó na mmó lyɛ̌ʼ nkÿo né móm lefɔ̌ɔn.
en: He displayed the glorious wealth of his kingdom and the magnificent splendor of his greatness   for a total of 180 days.

ngiemboon: Mɛ̌ melyɛ̌ʼ la gwɔ́ tà ńtɔ́g, fùɔ gíŋe ńtóŋo tsɔ́ máamáa línɔ̀ɔn, á gÿo lyɛ̌ʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, mé jÿó pɔ́ pǐ á tetʉ́a lemù. Mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn néŋe Sẅísè gẅie aa sẅɛ̂láʼ laa wó, tà fóo na melÿò ńkúu na gubé.
en: At the end of this time, the king held a week-long banquet   in the garden courtyard  # 1:5 2Kg 21:18; Est 7:7–8 of the royal palace  # 1:5 Est 2:8 for all the people, from the greatest to the least,  # 1:5 Est 1:20 who were present in the fortress of Susa.  # 1:5 Ezr 4:9

ngiemboon: Eshúm nzsǒ sie é la gẅiin liŋé séssé we lefaŋ, metsɔ́ gwɔ́ mie ée féfɔ́gɔ, é laa tetʉ́a, mbà mé ně ńdɔg menkÿo ńkwɛ́ mezẅé mɛ̌, ńgʉa ńcʉŋe na mekwáŋ mie é la shʉ́gte na mentóon mie mé ka kẅiŋ né meféfɔ́gɔ metǒon tʉ̀nzẅìŋ pie mé tóŋo lê máambèle ńkẅiŋ, epʉ̀a pie mé ka gúu wɔ́b línɔ̀ɔn néŋe na meshʉ̀shʉ̀a lʉŋ mie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ né tʉ̌ nkáb ńnyɛte. Melʉŋ amɛ̌ tyé na tsɔ́ jʉʼ mbà mé ka lɔg metǒon tʉ̀nzẅìŋ mentí mentí ńzye ssé.
en: White and blue linen hangings were fastened with fine white and purple linen cords to silver rods on marble   columns. Gold and silver couches  # 1:6 Est 7:8; Ezk 23:41; Am 6:4 were arranged on a mosaic pavement of red feldspar,  # 1:6 Or of porphyry marble, mother-of-pearl, and precious stones.

ngiemboon: Mentúʼ mie mé lɔ́ɔn ńdɔgɔ ńnúu melùʼ laa mentí mentí, mbà mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, melùʼ mie é fóo nɔʼ tyé tà ńdɔgɔ ńnyɛɛ pɔ́ metʉ̀ mie ée na lefùɔ sé.
en: Drinks were served in an array of gold goblets,   each with a different design. Royal wine flowed freely, according to the king’s bounty.  # 1:7 Est 2:18

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ lɔ̌ɔn ńnúu wé nzẅìŋ gẅie é ge kuʼu ná yé; mbà fùɔ ně ńzɔɔn ńgɔɔn mbwó patáŋte línɔ̀ɔn ngie pɔ́ nyé wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ, à nú mé melùʼ páʼ à kwǒŋ.
en: The drinking was according to royal decree: “There are no restrictions.” The king had ordered every wine steward in his household to serve whatever each person wanted.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ na yetsɔ́ gwǒŋ, mbà nzwě fùɔ gẅie mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo yé lé Vashÿeti ně ńgÿo yé tsɔ̌ máamáa línɔ̀ɔn, ńtíi panzwě á tsɛ̀ɛ ndá lemù fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè.
en: Queen Vashti also gave a feast for the women of King Ahasuerus’s palace.

ngiemboon: Mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌ʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a la gwɔ́, páʼ fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè nǔ melùʼ tà mbùm ye ne ńkyɛʼɛ la, á túmo Mehuman, mbɔɔ Mbizeta, mbɔɔ Ambona, mbɔɔ Mbigeta, mbɔɔ Ambagta, mbɔɔ Zetâa, ńgÿo Kaakásè, é pʉ̀a sɔɔnmbʉ́a pie mé la shʉ́ʉ wɔ́b pɔ́ piŋe faʼa mbwó fùɔ,
en: On the seventh day, when the king was feeling good from the wine,   Ahasuerus commanded Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona,  # 1:10 Est 7:9 Bigtha, Abagtha, Zethar, and Carkas #— #the seven eunuchs  # 1:10 2Kg 20:18; Est 2:21; 6:14; Mt 19:12 who personally served him #— #

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńtóŋo mvfò nzwě we Vashÿeti à tó ńtyé mvfò fùɔ né yɔb ntí nkàŋmbúm yé twó yé, ńdɔg ńnyɛɛ mbwó láʼ pâ pʉ̀a pie é sáʼa pʉ̀a, páʼ à sí púʼu, á nue á la gwaa gwɔ́, á zɔɔn shÿéenshÿeen sí.
en: to bring Queen Vashti before him with her royal crown. He wanted to show off her beauty to the people and the officials, because she was very beautiful.

ngiemboon: Táʼ mbàŋa ya gʉa ńgɔɔn nò gie fùɔ gɔ̌ɔn ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńtsẅii mbwó Vashÿeti á lʉʼ. Afùɔ júʼ púʼu ḿbú ńgyáŋa lóŋ, lóŋ we pú ffó.
en: But Queen Vashti refused to come at the king’s command that was delivered by his eunuchs. The king became furious and his anger burned within him.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ tóŋ pazsénò tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ pâ pɔ̌ shwóŋè. Á nue pazsénò na lepʉ̌ pâ pazsénò na tsẅé láʼ zɔ̌ lɔ́ɔn ńkẅéte fùɔ létáŋte menò.
en: The king consulted the wise men   who understood the times,  # 1:13 Or understood propitious times,# 1:13 1Ch 12:32 for it was his normal procedure to confer with experts in law and justice.

ngiemboon: Á la gʉa na panántÿɔgɔ́ pie é laa lejʉ́ŋ fùɔ: Wɔɔn laa Kaashÿena, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Shÿetaa, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Andemata, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Taasísè, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Melɛ́sè, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Maasena, ńgÿo Memunkaŋ, é lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ memǎa mengúmnɔ̀ɔn sɔɔnmbʉ́a pie é laa lejʉ́ŋ fùɔ, mbà pɔ́ zɔ̌ la tyé twómvfò na menò tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ.
en: The most trusted ones   were Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, and Memucan. They were the seven officials  # 1:14 Ezr 7:14 of Persia and Media  # 1:14 Dn 5:28 who had personal access to the king  # 1:14 2Kg 25:19 and occupied the highest positions in the kingdom.  # 1:14 Dn 2:48–49

ngiemboon: Fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Mèŋ fùɔ, mèŋ n ně ńtúm megàŋafàʼ pɔ́ɔn ngie pɔ́ gʉa ńtsẅii mbwó nzwě wɔ̀ɔn Vashÿeti ngie à tó, à ně te ncwò wɔ́ɔn júʼ. Lepʉ̌ ée péʼe ńgɔɔn ngie ngwɔ́ mé cúɔ yé né yɛ̌ ntí tsemé mmó?»
en: The king asked, “According to the law, what should be done with Queen Vashti, since she refused to obey King Ahasuerus’s command that was delivered by the eunuchs? ”

ngiemboon: Memunkaŋ tyé mvfò fùɔ pâ memǎa mengúmnɔ̀ɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: «Anò gie nzwě fùɔ gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Vashÿeti ka fʉa, á kaa zòonte. À ka te zoonte pɔ́ ndàʼ fùɔ wɔ́, á ka giŋé ńzoonte memǎa mengúmnɔ̀ɔn pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ metsɔ́ meláʼ mie fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè sáʼa.
en: Memucan said in the presence of the king and his officials, “Queen Vashti has wronged not only the king, but all the officials and the peoples who are in every one of King Ahasuerus’s provinces.

ngiemboon: Á nue panzwě metsèm ge gÿo júʼu mmó gie nzwě fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè ka gÿo, é zye legwág melúm pɔ́b, é gɔɔn ngie: “Afùɔ yé máŋwɛ́ ka tǔm ngie mé tóŋo nzwě we Vashÿeti ńná né yé, tá mé tóŋo yé, à te tó.”
en: For the queen’s action will become public knowledge to all the women and cause them to despise their husbands and say, ‘King Ahasuerus ordered Queen Vashti brought before him, but she did not come.’

ngiemboon: Tà fó lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, mezwě memǎa mengúmnɔ̀ɔn pʉ̀a Pɛ́ɛsè pɔ́ Mendɛ́sè pie é ge gÿo júʼu nò gie nzwě fùɔ ka fʉʼ lɔɔn, é gɔɔn yɔ́b púʼu mbwó melúm pɔ́b, ngwág yɔb gÿo melúm pɔ́b gyáŋa lóŋ!
en: Before this day is over, the noble women of Persia and Media who hear about the queen’s act will say the same thing to all the king’s officials, resulting in more contempt and fury.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgyá ngie áa mbòŋ mbà nkwɔbɔ́, ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ, ɔ̀ záb lepʉ̌ sie ngwɔ́ mé le kúbe, mé piŋ ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ mbʉ̌ pʉ̀a Pɛ́ɛsè pɔ́ Mendɛ́sè ngie Vashÿeti těen ńdáʼa ńgíŋe ńcʉa mvfò gù nkwɔbɔ́ wɔ́, mé piŋ ńkẅé lezíŋ lefùɔ sé ńnáa mbwó nyìŋ gẅie à ge gẅiin mekùʼ cʉa yé.
en: “If it meets the king’s approval, he should personally issue a royal decree. Let it be recorded in the laws of the Persians and the Medes, so that it cannot be revoked:   Vashti is not to enter King Ahasuerus’s presence, and her royal position is to be given to another woman who is more worthy than she.  # 1:19 Est 2:2,4,17

ngiemboon: Mé ge gwɔ́ tà júʼ sɔɔn lepʉ̌ sie fùɔ zabá tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ yé gie á seŋe seŋe, panzwě ntsèm gÿo mekùʼ melúm pɔ́b, léfó na melÿò tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ ńgʉa kúu na pʉ̀a pie é kuʼ yɔ́b kuʼ.»
en: The decree the king issues will be heard throughout his vast kingdom,   so all women will honor their husbands,  # 1:20 Est 1:10–12; Eph 5:22,24,33; Col 3:18; 1Tm 2:12; 1Pt 3:1 from the greatest to the least.”  # 1:20 Est 1:5

ngiemboon: Sɔɔn lepʉ̌ la poŋo fùɔ pâ patyé twómvfò lésáʼ pʉ̀a, afùɔ leen ńké ńgÿo mmó gie Memunkaŋ gɔ̌ɔn.
en: The king and his counselors approved the proposal, and he followed Memucan’s advice.

ngiemboon: À la túm meŋwàʼne ńnáa tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ mie à lɔ̌ɔn sáʼa, ńŋweʼe ye yɛ̌ láʼ wɔ́ɔ pɔ́ na ntí gie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ŋweʼe mmó púʼu, ńŋweʼe ye yɛ̌ láʼ wɔ́ɔ pɔ́ na shwóŋè láʼ yɔ́b, á laa tsoló mé gɔɔn ngie wɛ̌ mámbàŋa wɔ́ɔ ge sáʼ mbʉ̀a ye mboŋó, é piŋ shwóŋo kwàʼ shwóŋè láʼa yɔ́b.
en: He sent letters to all the royal provinces, to each province in its own script and to each ethnic group in its own language,   that every man should be master of his own house and speak in the language of his own people.
